Posts.Content: Hi folks  I've had worse news post surgery - what was thought to be a small grade 2 cancer has also shown up some grade 3 in the upper part of the breast. I was beginning to feel almost ok about my scar, the breast doesn't look too bad, and now...surgeon tells me because of the fact the cancer is sited in more than one site, and that the MRI didn't pick up this grade 3, only the histology report, they recommend a mastectomy.  This has been a hell of a shock and knocked me off my perch. I'm looking for a mastectomy buddy who might have been through similar or who can reassure me that mastectomy is the sensible way to go - seems so drastic from where I was only a month ago. Surgery scheduled for 30 August or 14 Sep, I feel like I've entered a parallel universe and things seem to be going too fast for me. : ( So looking for a buddy to ease me through this and help me accept it - I feel like a horse that is about to refuse the fence!

Posts.Content: Thanks for sharing something so intimate Jo. I am single so this is hitting hard, I was just plucking up courage to start dating again after a fairly difficult relationship ended, so confidence is a bit low anyway! Anyway we can only hope for the best but I'm just dreading the idea of actually having hormones suppressed to the extent your bones could be affected! loss of hormones during menopause made me go off sex, dryness, low libido, the lot and this is bound to do more of the same!  Doctors were sod all use if I'm honest. That's what made me go for HRT apart from the eternal flushes, looks like maybe that has done me no favours whatsoever. I don't want to carry on being single if I can help it, would love to be married even at 55 never have been! what an uphill journey this seems to be.  It's really good your husband can talk about it - so many people can't Lindsay x x x

Posts.Content: Thanks Trish, it looks like it has to be  - when I asked What happens if we do nothing and monitor, both nurse & surgeon said almost in one breath, Oh Please Don't, they have given me a window of 2 weeks to think about it, ie they've given me 2 possible surgerydates of 30 August or 14 Sept.
